title: Curb Your Enthusiasm for Amazon
text: To the Editor: Amazon.com is a must-have in every portfolio, but I think the degree of enthusiasm and optimism in this article is misplaced (“Amazon Unboxed,” Cover Story, July 22).

title: Amazon Q2 Results: AWS Shines Once Again
text: Amazon just reported its Q2 results, beating analyst expectations on revenue & exceeding the top end of management's guidance. It also saw operating income at the high end of its guidance, entirely thanks to AWS.

title: Apple, Amazon & Big Tech Showcase Their Earnings Power Once Again
text: No company is completely immune from cyclical forces.

title: What Recession? 5 Stocks Leading the Nasdaq to Its Best Month Since 2020
text: Amazon and Apple reported solid earnings Friday, and a rally among small- and mid-cap tech stocks and clean energy players has the Nasdaq up by more than 10% in July.

title: Big Tech's Reign Isn't Over Yet
text: Earnings season has offered a reminder about the value of tech. Why Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft remain strong buys.

title: Amazon could make one improvement to help future earnings results, analyst says
text: Considering all the challenges retailers are currently facing, analysts say Amazon.com Inc.'s results were pretty good, but GlobalData suggests there is something the e-commerce giant can do to possibly give a boost to future quarters.

title: Amazon Plans Another Prime Day Sale For October, Report Says
text: The two-day event will be called Prime Early Access Sale, according to Insider.

title: Despite A Quarterly Loss, Wall Street Satisfied With Amazon Report
text: Amazon stock jumped Friday after a second-quarter earnings report that, while missing earnings estimates, beat on revenue across the board. The post Despite A Quarterly Loss, Wall Street Satisfied With Amazon Report appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Amazon (AMZN) Reports Loss in Q2, Beats Sales Estimates
text: Amazon's (AMZN) second-quarter results reflect strength in AWS and the advertisement business amid a slowdown in online store sales and inflationary pressure.

title: Why Amazon Stock Soared on Friday
text: The digital retailer proved once and for all that its growth is alive and well.

title: Cloud Strength Takes Amazon (AMZN) Stock Up 12%
text: Amazon's (NASDAQ: AMZN ) second-quarter revenue surpassed expectations, as the conglomerate's cloud unit Amazon Web Services (AWS) performed very well in Q2. AMZN stock is jumping 12.5% in early trading.

title: Options Traders Blast Amazon Stock After Earnings
text: Big Tech earnings took center stage before the market opened, and Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) highlighted the batch, with its shares up 12.4% to trade at $137.42, at last glance.

title: Oppenheimer & Co raises Amazon price target after online retailer's 2Q results "exceeded expectations"
text: Oppenheimer & Co has upped its price target for Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) after the e-commerce giant's 2Q results posted after the bell on Thursday “exceeded expectations.” Amazon's revenue growth of 7% topped analyst estimates with the company forecasting 3Q revenue between $125 billion and $130 billion, compared to the consensus analyst expectation of $126.4 billion.

title: Amazon stock surges toward biggest monthly gain in 15 years
text: Shares of Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +11.15% shot up 11.8% in morning trading Friday, in the wake of second-quarter results, to put them on for the best one-month gain in more than 15 years. The stock has run up 28.8% in July, to snap a three-month losing streak in which it tumbled 34.8%, amid growing concerns over the effect historically high inflation and a slowing economy would have on the ecommerce giant's customers.

title: Amazon is doubling down on its warehouse strategy
text: So far in 2022, Amazon's U.S. facility network has flopped. After more than doubling its warehouse square footage since the start of the pandemic, the company has been hit with a wave of delays and closures.

title: Apple and Amazon Earnings Add More Fuel to Growth Stocks' Fire
text: Source: eamesBot / Shutterstock The stock market is in major rebound mode, and we think there are some even bigger gains on the horizon . Since mid-June, the S&P 500 is up 11% – an impressive gain for a market that's been crushed all year long.

title: Andy Jassy: Boost Amazon Stock By Freeing Services From Products
text: Why won't Amazon's board unlock the caged value of AWS and Advertising to make investors better off?

title: Amazon shares rally after strong second quarter and guidance
text: Amazon reported upbeat results in an otherwise gloomy earnings season for most of the technology sector.

title: Amazon shares surge on Q2 sales beat as analysts highlight the strength of AWS, Prime and advertising
text: Amazon.com Inc. shares climbed more than 10% in premarket trading on Friday, boosted by the tech giant's second-quarter sales beat and robust third-quarter guidance.

title: Amazon soars more than 10% on sunny 3Q revenue forecast despite 2Q earnings miss
text: Amazon Inc has revealed a promising outlook for its third quarter 2022 revenue forecasts despite posting a loss in its second-quarter results. The firm's shares shot up more than 10% in pre-market trading on Friday to about $135 per share after its 2Q revenue growth of 7% topped estimates, putting it in a venerated position amongst its technology cohorts.

title: Amazon beats expectations to avoid tech earnings slump
text: Amazon appears to still be going strong even as other Big Tech companies stumble amid pressure from inflation and an economic downturn.

title: 'Back on track with reaccelerating revenue': Amazon soars 11% after second-quarter earnings calm investor nerves
text: "We also can't remember a more anticipated period of content for Prime Video, which should pay dividends," JPMorgan said.

title: For Amazon Stock, There's Only 1 Number That Matters
text: The cloud infrastructure business remains a juggernaut.

title: Amazon, Apple, Google and Tesla have all done it. Here's why companies split their stock
text: A stock split is not uncommon for big names like Amazon, Apple and Tesla. CNBC's Emily Lorsch explains what happens when a company splits its stock.

title: Will Amazon and GrubHub take a bite out of Uber and DoorDash's food-delivery dominance?
text: Amazon.com Inc. is jumping further into the food-delivery business by teaming up with Grubhub, just as some analysts say they see the pandemic-induced spike in that market slowing. So what does that mean for dominant U.S. delivery companies Uber Technologies Inc. and DoorDash Inc.?

title: Everything We Like And Dislike About Amazon's Q2 2022 Earnings
text: Amazon's market value surged overnight after releasing stronger-than-expected second quarter results with a solid forward guidance that demonstrated resilience against worsening macro headwinds. The company delivered impressive growth across its core commerce (3P & FBA, Prime), cloud-computing (AWS), and advertising businesses despite substantial exposure to risks of waning consumption.

title: Nasdaq futures surge as Apple, Amazon hold out against weak consumer spending
text: U.S. stocks futures gained led by the Nasdaq on Friday as positive forecasts from Apple and Amazon indicated resilience in mega-cap companies in the face of weaker consumer spending, with hopes of a less aggressive monetary policy boosting sentiment.

title: Apple and Amazon's Tech Strength Gets Bulls Buying Despite Recession on the Radar
text: Recession, what recession? Apple and Amazon.com reported results after the latest Federal Reserve decision, but their results fit with Chair Jerome Powell's declaration that too many areas of the U.S. economy were performing too well for recession to have begun—a day before Commerce Department data suggested that, by some measures, it had.

title: Stock futures boosted by jumps for Apple and Amazon after earnings
text: U.S. stock futures rose on Friday after Wall Street welcomed Amazon and Apple earnings amid hopes for a slower pace of Fed tightening.

title: Amazon rallies 13% after-hours beating earnings with solid AWS growth
text: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) stock rallied by over 13% in the after-hours trading session after investors digested the firm's earnings guidance

title: Stock Gains for Apple and Amazon Lift All of Big Tech
text: Apple and Amazon are rising after quarterly results, giving a lift to shares of other tech giants, such as Microsoft and Alphabet.
